info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL SHELBY, NORTHERN AUGLAIZE AND WEST CENTRAL HARDIN COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Wapakoneta, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Wapakoneta, Fort Shawnee, Cridersville, Botkins, Alger, Waynesfield, Moulton, Buckland, Uniopolis, Fryburg, Jumbo, St. Johns, Walton, New Hampshire and State Route 195 at State Route 235. This includes I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 105 and 118. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for west central Ohio. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
